title: Bypassing character blocklists with unicode overflows
summary: Unicode codepoint truncation - also called a Unicode overflow attack - happens when a server tries to store a Unicode character in a single byte.

title: Best practices for key derivation
summary: By Marc Ilunga Key derivation is essential in many cryptographic applications, including key exchange, key management, secure communications, and building robust cryptographic primitives.
